intro: Holosteum umbellatum subsp. viscosissimum, commonly known as the viscid holosteum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy, viscid leaves that give it a sticky texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically clustered at the ends of its stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within the Rubiaceae family.
